Lobbyist Name: Autism Spectrum Information, Advice and Meeting Point Ltd, Trading as AsIAm
Specific Details: Representatives from our organisation met with Senator Marie Sherlock to discuss details related to Parliamentary Questions around autistic people and employment, and to brief the Senator on wider employment issues facing autistic people living in Ireland.
Subject Matter: Representatives from our organisation met with Senator Marie Sherlock to discuss details related to Parliamentary Questions around autistic people and employment, and to brief the Senator on wider employment issues facing autistic people living in Ireland.
Intended Results: We sought clarity on figures from Intreo relating to how many job coaches and how much public monies had been spent thus far on upskilling and supporting autistic people in finding work.
Lobbying Activities: We liaised with Senator Sherlock's office, as Labour's Seanad Spokesperson on Enterprise and Employment and a member of the Oireachtas Enterprise Committee, to secure a meeting with her to set up a meeting.|Email|2-5::Representatives from our organisation organised a virtual meeting with the Senator where we went over in detail about our parliamentary questions and our wider projects on supported employment for autistic people.|Virtual Meeting|1

Specific Details: Email updating the Health Committee and local politicians of the ongoing failure of Beaumont Hospital to return the IKA Renal Support Centre upon the expiry of the Agreement between both parties, in order to ensure that the centre can be restored to its original purpose - that of providing support and accommodation to renal patients from all over the country travelling to Beaumont for treatment
Subject Matter: Email updating the Health Committee and local politicians of the ongoing failure of Beaumont Hospital to return the IKA Renal Support Centre upon the expiry of the Agreement between both parties, in order to ensure that the centre can be restored to its original purpose - that of providing support and accommodation to renal patients from all over the country travelling to Beaumont for treatment
Intended Results: To inform public officials of the ongoing situation with Beaumont Hospital with a view to engaging support in order to restore the Renal Support Centre to the IKA if no progress is being made in current discussions between both parties upon the expiry of the Agreement
Lobbying Activities: Email sent on 12.07.23 to update public officials on the lack of progress in having the Renal Support Centre returned to the IKA.|Email|1

Lobbyist Name: The Union of Retail ,Bar and Administrative Workers
Specific Details: National Minimum Wage (Equal Pay for Young Workers) Bill 2022 - Mandate Fair Wages For All Ages Campaign
Subject Matter: National Minimum Wage (Equal Pay for Young Workers) Bill 2022 - Mandate Fair Wages For All Ages Campaign
Intended Results: Abolishment of Sub Minimum Wage - Mandate Trade Union is campaigning to end discrimination against young workers by abolishing the Sub-Minimum Wage, which is below the National Minimum Wage.
Lobbying Activities: In person meeting with Marie Sherlock TD Seanad Whip; Party Spokesperson on Employment Affairs, Media, Arts, Culture and the Gaeltacht, Mandate Greg Caffrey, Ken Reilly, Eoin Coates and Cian Keogh on Thursday 10th October 2024 in Leinster House. Deputy Sherlock has committed to support Mandate's Fair Wages For All Ages Campaign and the Respect at Work Campaign.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Lorraine O'Brien, Mandate General Secretary - Greg Caffrey, Ken Reilly, Eoin Coates, Cian Keogh - Mandate
Grassroots directive: To discuss the Directive on Adequate Minimum Wages (AMW) and secure support for the Respect at Work Campaign. The Sub-Minimum Wage directly discriminates against young workers as it provides for young workers to be legally paid significantly lower rates of pay than that the National Minimum Wage solely based upon a Young Worker's age.
